馮.definition: to gallop; to assist; to attack; to wade; great; old variant of 憑|凭[ping2]

馮夢龍.definition: Feng Menglong (1574-1646), late Ming dynasty novelist writing in colloquial (baihua), author of Stories Old and New 古今小說|古今小说[Gu3 jin1 Xiao3 shuo1]

馮德英.definition: Feng Deying (1935-2022), author of the 1958 novel Bitter Herbs 苦菜花[Ku3cai4hua1]

馮德萊恩.definition: Ursula von der Leyen (1958-), German politician, president of the European Commission from 2019

馮武.definition: Feng Doubo or Feng Wu (1672-), calligrapher of the Ming-Qing transition; also called 馮竇伯|冯窦伯[Feng2 Dou4 bo2]

馮玉祥.definition: Feng Yuxiang (1882-1948), warlord during Republic of China, strongly critical of Chiang Kai-shek

馮竇伯.definition: Feng Doubo or Feng Wu (1672-), calligrapher of the Ming-Qing transition; also called 馮武|冯武[Feng2 Wu3]

馮驥才.definition: Feng Jicai (1942-), novelist from Tianjin, author of Extraordinary people in our ordinary world 俗世奇人
